suncertify.db

Class DBRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.server.ContractorRecord
      • suncertify.db.DBRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    class DBRecord
extends ContractorRecord
    The DBRecord class encapsulates a contractor record, it extends the ContractorRecord.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    ContractorRecord

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBRecord

        DBRecord(java.lang.String[] fields,
         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Short> dbMetaData,
         int recNo)
        The constructor.
        Parameters:
        fields - An array of String objects denoting the attributes of the record.
        dbMetaData - A reference to a Map object denoting the schema data for a record in the database.
        recNo - The unique identifier for this record.

      • DBRecord

        DBRecord(byte[] buf,
         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Short> metaData,
         int recNo,
         short recFlag)
        The constructor.
        Parameters:
        buf - An array of bytes denoting the attributes of the new record.
        metaData - A reference to a Map object denoting the schema data for a record in the database.
        recNo - The unique identifier for this record.
        recFlag - The status flag for the record.

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        void delete()
        This method changes the status flag on the record to delete. It does not delete the record from the data file.

      • undelete

        void undelete()
        This method undeletes a record by changing the status flag on the record to valid.

      • setFieldsValues

        void setFieldsValues(java.lang.String[] values,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Short> dbMetaData)
        This method assigns the attributes in the input parameter to the attributes of this record. The assigned values are padded with space so the attribute lengths match what is specified in the schema for each respective attribute.
        Parameters:
        values - An array of String objects denoting the attributes of the record.
        dbMetaData - A reference to a Map object providing schema information.

      • getFieldsValues

        java.lang.String[] getFieldsValues()
        This method returns an array of String objects denoting the attributes of this record.
        Returns:
        A reference to an array of String objects.

      • writeFlagToFile

        void writeFlagToFile(java.io.RandomAccessFile file)
              throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the status flag of this record to the database file argument provided. The method assumes that the file pointer is at the right location in the data file for the status flag attribute of this record.
        Parameters:
        file - A reference to a RandomAccessFile object to which the flag will be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error is encountered while writing to the data file.

      • writeToFile

        void writeToFile(java.io.RandomAccessFile file)
          throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the attributes of this record to the database file argument provided. The method assumes that the file pointer is at the right location in the data file for this record.
        Parameters:
        file - A reference to a valid DataOutputStream object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error is encountered while writing to the data file.

      • matchesName

        private boolean matchesName(java.lang.String value)
        This determines if the parameter String matches the name attribute of this record.
        • A null value or spaces or zero length string in the criterion is considered a wild card.
        • The match ignores case. "John" will match "john".
        • It is considered a match if this record's name attribute starts with the text of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - A reference to a String object denoting the criterion.
        Returns:
        A boolean value true if the name matches and false otherwise.

      • matchesLocation

        private boolean matchesLocation(java.lang.String value)
        This determines if the parameter String matches the location attribute of this record.
        • A null value or spaces or zero length string in the criterion is considered a wild card.
        • The match ignores case. "BOSTON" will match "boston".
        • It is considered a match if this record's location attribute starts with the text of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - A String denoting the location criterion.
        Returns:
        boolean value true if there is a match, false otherwise.

      • matchesSpecialities

        private boolean matchesSpecialities(java.lang.String value)
        This method determines if all the values in the parameter String has a match in the list of specialities for this record.
        • A null value or spaces or zero length string in the criterion is considered a wild card.
        • There could be one or more criterion in the argument, for this to be considered a match, each criterion must have a match in this record list of specialities.
        • It is considered a match if one of this record's specialities starts with the text of the criterion.
        Parameters:
        value - A reference to a String object denoting the specialities criteria. There could be one or more speciality in this argument, which means the criteria will be coma delimited.
        Returns:
        boolean value true if there is a match, false otherwise.

      • matchesSize

        private boolean matchesSize(java.lang.String value)
                     throws DBAccessException
        This determines if the parameter String matches the size attribute of this record.
        • A null value or spaces or zero length string in the criterion is considered a wild card.
        • It is considered a match if this record's size attribute is greater than or equal to the value specified in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - A String denoting the search criterion
        Returns:
        boolean true if there is a match, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DBAccessException

      • matchesRate

        private boolean matchesRate(java.lang.String value)
                     throws DBAccessException
        This determines if the parameter String matches the rate attribute of this record.
        • A null value or spaces or zero length string in the criterion is considered a wild card.
        • It is considered a match if this record's rate attribute is less than or equal to the value specified in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - A String denoting the search criterion
        Returns:
        boolean true if there is a match, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DBAccessException

      • matchesOwner

        private boolean matchesOwner(java.lang.String value)
        This determines if the parameter String matches the location attribute of this record.
        • A null value or spaces or zero length string in the criterion is considered a wild card.
        • If the criterion value equals "-", it is a match if the record is booked.
        • If the criterion value equals "+", it is a match if the record is not booked.
        • It is considered a match if this record's owner attribute starts with the text of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - A String denoting the location criterion.
        Returns:
        boolean value true if there is a match, false otherwise.

      • matchesCriteria

        boolean matchesCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
        This method matches each attribute of this record to each corresponding criterion in the array of String objects provided.
        • When the "name" and "location" values are specified in the criteria array and each of the other criteria is equal to null or space or zero length String, the search is considered a "key" search. This means that only undeleted records that match both the "name" and "location" exactly will be returned.
        • For this record to be considered a match, its attributes must match all the criteria specified.
        Parameters:
        criteria - An array of String objects.
        Returns:
        A boolean value true if this record matches the specified criterian and false otherwise.
        See Also:
        matchesName(String), matchesLocation(String), matchesSpecialities(String), matchesSize(String), matchesRate(String), matchesOwner(String)

      • isDeleted

        boolean isDeleted()
        This method indicates whether a record has been deleted or not.
        Returns:
        boolean value true if the record has been deleted, false otherwise.
